snippet: The ruling, echoing arguments used in a preliminary injunction last year, said the labels unconstitutionally infringed on the tobacco industry’s First Amendment rights.
abstract: Federal district court Judge Richard J Leon declares unconstitutional a Food and Drug Administration requirement that tobacco companies prominently display graphic warning labels on cigarette packages; ruling says labels violate industry's free speech rights under the First Amendment to the Constitution.
lead_paragraph: The ruling, echoing arguments used in a preliminary injunction last year, said the labels unconstitutionally infringed on the tobacco industry’s First Amendment rights.

headline.seo: U.S. Judge Rejects Gruesome Cigarette Labels
headline.main: U.S. Judge Strikes Down F.D.A. Cigarette Labels
headline.print_headline: U.S. Judge Strikes Down F.D.A. Cigarette Labels
